metadata.name: Logic App Integration Account
metadata.description: This module deploys a Logic App Integration Account.
Required. The Name of the partner resource.
Optional. The B2B partner content settings.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account partner.
Required. The Name of the certificate resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Optional. The key details in the key vault.
Optional. The certificate metadata.
Optional. The public certificate.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account certificate.
Required. The Name of the schema resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Required. The schema content.
Optional. The schema content type.
Optional. The document name.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. The schema type.
Optional. The target namespace of the schema.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account schema.
Required. The name of the map resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Required. The content of the map.
Optional. The content type of the map.
Optional. The map type. Default is "Xslt".
Optional. The parameters schema of integration account map.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account map.
Required. The Name of the assembly resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Required. The assembly name.
Required. The assembly content.
Optional. The assembly content type.
Optional. The assembly metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account assembly.
Required. The name of the agreement resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Required. The agreement type.
Required. The guest identity for the agreement.
Required. The guest partner name for the agreement.
Required. The host identity for the agreement.
Required. The host partner name for the agreement.
Required. The agreement content settings.
Optional. The agreement metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The type for an integration account agreement.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Specify the notes of the lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of the integration account to create.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. All partners to create.
Optional. All schemas to create.
Optional. All maps to create.
Optional. All assemblies to create.
Optional. All certificates to create.
Optional. All agreements to create.
Optional. The state. Allowed values are Completed, Deleted, Disabled, Enabled, NotSpecified, Suspended.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Integration account sku name.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Integration Account Partners
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Partner.
Required. The Name of the partner resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Conditional. The name of the parent integration account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. B2B partner content settings.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account partner.
The name of the integration account partner.
The resource group the integration account partner was deployed into.

metadata.name: Integration Account Schemas
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Schema.
Required. The Name of the schema resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Conditional. The name of the parent integration account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The schema content.
Optional. The schema content type.
Optional. The document name.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. The schema type.
Optional. The target namespace of the schema.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account schema.
The name of the integration account schema.
The resource group the integration account schema was deployed into.

metadata.name: Integration Account Maps
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Map.
Required. The name of the map resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Conditional. The name of the parent integration account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The content of the map.
Optional. The content type of the map.
Optional. The map type.
Optional. A metadata key-value pair.
Optional. The metadata.
Optional. The parameters schema of integration account map.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account map.
The name of the integration account map.
The resource group the integration account map was deployed into.

metadata.name: Integration Account Assemblies
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Assembly.
Required. The Name of the assembly resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Conditional. The name of the parent integration account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The assembly name.
Required. The Base64-encoded assembly content.
Optional. The assembly content type.
Optional. The assembly metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account assembly.
The name of the integration account assembly.
The resource group the integration account assembly was deployed into.

metadata.name: Integration Account Certificates
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Certificate.

Optional. The key details in the key vault.
Optional. The certificate metadata.
Optional. The public certificate.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account certificate.
The name of the integration account certificate.

metadata.name: Integration Account Agreements
metadata.description: This module deploys an Integration Account Agreement.
Required. The Name of the agreement resource.
Optional. Resource location.
Conditional. The name of the parent integration account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The agreement type.
Required. The business identity of the guest partner.
Required. The integration account partner that is set as guest partner for this agreement.
Required. The business identity of the host partner.
Required. The integration account partner that is set as host partner for this agreement.
Required. The agreement content.
Optional. The agreement metadata.
Optional. Resource tags.
The resource ID of the integration account agreement.
The name of the integration account agreement.
The resource group the integration account agreement was deployed into.
The resource ID of the integration account.
The name of the integration account.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The resource group the integration account was deployed into.
